item.description:
Since Saturday, leaders of the countries that are part of the BRICS Group have been gathered in Rio de Janeiro for another summit designed to think about the reform of institutions and inclusion of more emerging economies, as well as the fight against Trump's rates. Highlight for the absences of Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin
Since Saturday, Rio de Janeiro hosts the BRICS Group leaders, which ends today. The first day was based on the dialogue around the ambition of emerging economies to reform international institutions and the defense of multilateralism. "I think the main message is this: at the time of so many international crises, conflicts, we are experiencing a succession of conflicts that only increase from year to year, having a set of countries reaffirming the power of diplomacy, cooperation, the need to act jointly, to solve the problems of the population and not to generate more destruction, such as conflicts, it is an opportunity that we always have to take advantage of," Lyrio, guide of discussions and agreements of heads of state at the conference, designated by the Brazilian presidency of the BRICS. In all, about 30 countries and nine international organizations have been present, with the Brazilian head of state, Lula da Silva leading the meeting, which has Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, Angola President and African Union, the Secretary-General of United Nations, António Guterres, among others. The main absences are Russian and Chinese heads of state, two BRICS founding countries. Vladimir Putin, the target of a warrant of detention issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC), on suspicion of illegal deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia, will only participate in video conferencing. Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will be the representatives of the two founding countries of the group, which represents more than 40 percent of the global population and more than 35 percent of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) worldwide. From China with Love According to Chinese state agency Xinhua, Chinese prime minister promised to “expand cooperation with Brazil” in the areas of “digital and aerospace economy”. Li Qiang spoke on Saturday, as part of a meeting with Lula da Silva, noting that the country intends to “work with Brazil to take advantage of each other and expand cooperation in areas such as digital economy, green economy, scientific and technological and aerospace innovation”. Xinhua quotes words from Li Qiang, who referred to the fact that “China is ready to work with Brazil to continue efforts to enrich the dimensions of bilateral relations and achieve more concrete results in cooperation in order to provide more benefits to both peoples”. One of the points out of this meeting was the realization in 2026 of the year of China-Brazil culture, which provides for an intensification in cooperation in areas such as “education, youth and health”, in order to facilitate “more exchanges between peoples and strengthen public support to China-Brazil's friendship and cooperation”. “China is willing to work with Brazil to further consolidate and deepen bilateral cooperation in trade, finance and infrastructure development within the high quality cooperation of Belt And Road [track and route]”, the Chinese prime minister, who did not forget the great flag of this BRICS Summit: multilateralism. Thus, I read Qiang considered “the two countries as fierce defenders of multilateralism and free trade”, saying that “China is willing to improve communication and coordination with Brazil in multilateral structures such as the United Nations, BRICS and G20, work in union with developing countries to promote an equal and ordered multipolar world and universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization, and provide more certainty and stability to the world. ” On the other hand, Lula da Silva said that "Brazil is willing to deepen communication and multilateral coordination with China, to oppose unilateralism and defend multilateralism and free trade in order to promote peace and world development." After the meeting between the two leaders, “cooperation documents in areas such as tax and financial matters, artificial intelligence, alignment of development strategies and aerospace” were signed.
Cuba's debut Cuba President Miguel Díaz-Canel also participates in the 17th BRICS Summit, being the first time Cuba has associated with this geopolitical and economic cooperation group. Under the motto “reinforcing cooperation in the global south for more inclusive and sustainable governance”, the BRICS Summit's agenda comprises two central axes: the consolidation of cooperation between the global southern countries and the promotion of reforms in international governance mechanisms. Created in 2009 throughout Brazil, Russia, India and China, BRICS admitted South Africa two years later and, since last year, integrates six new effective members: Egypt, United Arab Emirates, Ethiopia, Iran, Indonesia and Saudi Arabia. Brazil invited to this summit leaders from various Latin American countries, including Mexico, Colombia, Uruguay and Chile. The statute of associate, which takes Cuba to Rio de Janeiro, was approved in October 2024 during the summit of the group held in the Russian city of Kazan, which was made official in 2025, recalled the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Caribbean country. In addition to geopolitical issues, BRICS have sought in Rio de Janeiro in the organization's economic weight, namely in the financial domain, in which they have been looking for a dollar for years for trade in the group. The host president, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, president of Brazil, stressed last Friday the importance of a mechanism with these characteristics, recognizing, however, that the current international political context is "complicated". What is on the agenda On the first day, the heads of state and government of the BRICS participated in two plenary sessions, particularly on "peace and safety and reform of global governance" and the second relative to the strengthening of multilateralism, economic and financial affairs and artificial intelligence. " In the latter, the revision of the ACCIORARY participation in the World Bank, the realignment of IMF shares [International Monetary Fund] and the increase in the representation of developing countries in leadership positions in international financial institutions and the importance of reforming the UN Security Council. In addition, as it has been happening during the BRICS ministerial meetings over the past few months, an increase in unilateral unilateral unilateral protectionist measures should be made in reference to the measures announced by the President of the United States, Donald Trump; as well as an appeal to reinforce the use of local currencies in trade between the bloc countries. Today the plenary session will be on “Environment, COP30 and Global Health”. The term BRIC was created by a Goldman Sachs analyst to refer to emerging economies who began to stand out worldwide beyond the US, with the BRICS first gathered at the level of heads in 2009. This is the first meeting that brings together the new group configuration with 11 member countries. Brazil has mobilized about 20,000 military personnel, as well as fighters with missiles, anti-drug systems and elite shooters to ensure the safety of the event. The safety operation, called Operational Command Redeemer Set, also provides for the use of 300 vehicles, 38 armored vehicles, 18 boats and eight helicopters.

item.title: Coloane | Filipe Afonso launches work that highlights the importance of staff houses
item.description:
The latest book by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the Architecture course at the University of São José, looks at a housing model at risk of disappearing, but can be seen in Coloane, or in old fishing zones of Hong Kong. “Coloane Grammar” presents alternative solutions for the reuse of these houses and their classification as a heritage
Taking the idea of ​​grammar that names the book, what are the main terms or concepts around Coloane, its tradition and preservation that can enumerate? The “grammar” of the book introduces the concept of vernacular architecture, which reflects the knowledge of the informal, local construction and the maritime identity of this Coloane community. It addresses the assets at risk, proposing a method of cataloging existing houses, this digital method, which establishes a dialogue between tradition and modernity to preserve this cultural landscape. What concrete proposals are suggested in the book for the protection and preservation of Coloane's stilts? The book proposes (indirectly) the classification of stilts as a heritage to give them legal protection. By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection. How could we reuse the stilts taking into account these specific ways of life and the economic diversification that the government wants to achieve? The stilts could be reused for experience tourism, or centers of cultural interpretation, valuing local history. They can be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the water line, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification. Why approach Coloane and the stilts? How did this project come about? Coloane and the stilts were approached by their architectural and cultural uniqueness, representing a threatened memory and identity of Macao. This assets at risk has a significant potential. The project also emerged from the gap of scientific knowledge about these structures and the urgent need for documentation, consolidating itself as an academic-scientific investigation. In the Asian or Southeast Asian context, are the coloane stilts or not unique in architectural terms? Water constructions are common in various Asian countries, Coloane's stilts are not a unique case in terms of existence. See the example, in Hong Kong, of the well-known Tai o village, but are unique in their specific context. Its architecture is the reflection of local regional influences and materials, adapted to the history of the evolution of Colona's fishing community and the development of Macao. Its value lies in its particular architectural language and its persistence in a rapidly transformed urban environment. What is the story behind the emergence of stilts? Are you associated with Coloane piracy reports, for example, which refer to the early twentieth century? The stilts emerged as a practical and functional solution to the sea -related way of life, allowing sea access, tidal protection and efficient use of space in coastal areas. Piracy reports in Coloane were not the direct cause of their emergence. Shapes are essentially the response of an informal architecture of local communities to adapt to the maritime environment. Museum Idea on Coloane Stop Stand since 2017 The need for preservation of coloane stilts is not a recent idea. Between 2017 and 2018, the Directorate of Tourism Services proposed the creation of a museum entirely dedicated to the stories of these dwellings arranged in Rua dos Navegantes, but the project was being postponed for legal reasons. In 2018, the Tribuna de Macao newspaper (JTM) published an article where it referred precisely the absence of “legal foundations” for the construction of new infrastructure in the Maritime area of ​​Macao, something that has changed, however, given that the MSAR passed, from 2018, to include in its jurisdiction the management of 85 square kilometers of maritime zones. Last year alone, the executive's plans for the creation of a “functional maritime zoning”, “maritime areas” and other related laws, and a concrete decision on what will be made on what will be made on the stilts. Both zoning and plan will be defined for a temporal period by 2040. One of the objectives of the executive is environmental and ecological preservation, as well as certain experiences of the population. One of the points of the public consultation report speaks of “optimizing ocean exploration modalities according to Macau's development needs; coordinating the use of sea in production, daily life of the population and ecology” and performing “intensive and economizers uses to realize the rational allocation of maritime resources”. In 2018, according to the JTM, STD assured that it would be necessary to “wait for the publication of the maritime area and administrative regulation on the administration of the use of maritime zones” and only then could you think of the planning of the museum. HM questioned STD of this article, and until the closing of this edition, obtained new clarifications. A gradual development In a master's dissertation in architecture, defended in 2023 at the University of Coimbra, Ana Rita Rodrigues made the study of the “Evolution of Macao Territory-Aterros and Urban Design in the Taipa and Coloane islands”, and concluded that “Portuguese occupation in the islands of Taipa and Coloane brought improvements in infrastructure, safety and village organization”. In the late nineteenth century, "there were already, in the islands, schools, hospitals and basic infrastructure, promoting the economic growth of the region." Referring to the existence of stilts “used for the construction of fishing and housing boats for fishermen, naturally facing the river”, in a coloane zone composed “by precarious housing of one or two floors, unlike the type of common housing found in mud or macao, which was more focused on high development”. The author also points out that “development was slower” in Coloane, as well as the absence, on both islands, of “a unified general plan and the need for better urban planning to ensure a cohesive and sustainable environment”.

item.title: Teaching | I was entering local schools, but resources are scarce
item.description:
The government has been betting on the introduction of artificial intelligence in territory schools, but with a few hours in the curriculum. In addition, schools complain of few resources to meet government goals
Macao schools have integrated artificial intelligence tools (AI) in classrooms, such as smart paintings and linguistic models, but some teachers warn that most are not prepared to comply with outlined policy for the sector. After classes, students at Pui Va Secondary School remain in the classroom, distracted to explore a smart condition. These staff - explains Ruan Zhan Teng, school teacher at the school - act as interactive projectors and are used as soon as the first year, to write, watch videos or participate in classes with digital media. "In the third year, students begin to learn to identify artificial intelligence in everyday life, basic programming and photos and videos generated by AI," the computer teacher added to Lusa. The change took place in 2024 and is stipulated in the law: AI should be included in primary education (with a workload of 17 hours and 20 minutes per year), from 7th to 9th grade (19 hours and 20 minutes) and from 10th to 12th (18 hours and 40 minutes). Despite the requirement, Andy Chun Wai Fan, professor and director of the University of Macao Information and Communication Center in Education, Note that schools face two obstacles: lack of resources and faculty formation. “Some schools have only one information technology teacher,” said Fan, also referring that institutions generally have computer classes only once a week. Do not update Pedro Lobo, a teacher in this area, with 30 years of experience in the territory, including at the Portuguese School of Macau, is concerned about the lack of training. "Most teachers are already a certain age, they have not grown with this new technology ... So the mindset is still short of all this evolution, and change is being so fast that it can hardly follow," explained the Portuguese. Education authorities require teachers 30 hours of annual IA training, however, Pedro Lobo considers not sufficient. Although this year has already studied almost 40 hours, the teacher says he is "little prepared". Regarding this government policy, Andy Chun Wai Fan also remembers that it is required to schools that address ethics, innovation and collaboration in the domain of AI, although it fits the institutions the creation of the manuals themselves. “We do not have a manual about what to teach (…), each school has its own ideas about what to do with its students,” wolf reacted, explaining that he teaches “transferring AI to school work”, either through image generation, small game development, AI ethics approach and copyright issues. Since 2021 at PUI VA In a different record, the Pui Va Secondary School, which introduced AI in 2021, assumes to be “well prepared” to “the change”. The institution spends about two million patacas a year on AI tools, employs seven information technology teachers (IT) and hired a university professor in Beijing to support. “We want students to be able to use artificial intelligence to identify problems and solve real -life problems,” noticed the IT Office Director of Chinese educational establishment, Chong Wai Yin. Here, students work, for example, with programming languages ​​(Python, Tencent, Iflytek), and AI models such as Deepseek and ChatgPT, engaging in intelligent city projects, in the first cycle, and in the creation of applications, at a later stage, said Zhao Qihao, former professor at the University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, who taught in Puija VA. “In the first cycle, we developed smart cities, automated houses and AI -powered parking systems (…). In the second cycle, students create mobile applications and sustainable technological projects,” he explained. In April, the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, LAM, announced that Macao's educational reforms for 2025 will focus on AI and include plans for an intelligent classroom in all schools. The Government of Macao attributed to the school network under the direction of the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) 15 million PATACA for AI software for this academic year. In an email sent to Lusa, DSEDJ stated that the government “attributes great importance” to the teaching of information technologies. "The medium and long term plan for non-higher education (2021-2030) identified 'reinforcement of creativity and technological education' as one of the main directions of development," he explains in the note. However, Pedro Lobo questions the pressure on young students: "Are we seeing children 8, 9, 10 years old to develop applications? Maybe 1 percent is capable. The rest does the best they can. They have classes and homework that never end." Concerned deputies In the last debate of the Legislative Assembly, last Thursday, two deputies, Iau Teng Pio and Kou Kam Fai, linked to education, defended the need for “high quality development of education in Macao”, namely with the bet on AI. One of the suggestions, referred to during the interventions before the order of day, was the reinforcement of the “coordinated development mechanism between education, scientific and technological innovation and talents”, with the increase of “Stem resources [science, technology, engineering and mathematics] and artificial intelligence on basic education, rooting the basis of scientific literacy”. In the debate on the 11th of this month, it was up to Deputy Ma Io Fong to appeal to AI regulation to avoid scams, but also to increase the awareness of society in relation to this new reality. “With the rapid development of technology these days, the use of AI functions is gradually becoming important help for society and residents in daily life and work. However, AI can give rise to illicit acts, especially the worsening cyber attacks and the diffusion of false information.” Also during the period of interventions before the agenda, the deputy asked the executive to “reinforce sensitization and education on the prevention of AI fraud, to sensitize the elderly and young people, emphasizing that the dissemination of false videos generated by AI can be a legal offense with serious consequences”. In this context, the systematic integration of “AI safety knowledge in school curricula and the realization of different awareness and education activities with community associations was requested to increase public knowledge about AI technology and the risk derived for its abuse”. "It is also due, through cooperation between the government, society, schools and the family, to reinforce the ability to respond to information and the internet discourse, allowing to react, clarify and follow up on useful time, when the public faces information that can cause negative influences or be misleading," said Ma Io Fong in the 11th debate.

item.title: History | The MA-chan escape to the colonial and macau
item.description:
The MA-chan family is from Mozambique with Chinese roots, sought its new path in the then colonial Portugal and since 1976 that set roots in Macao. José Manuel Machon, resident in the territory since he was 13, told Lusa the very peculiar trajectory of his family, which reflects many of the family directions taken in the years of war and the end of the Portuguese colonial empire
The MA-chan, the Mozambican family with roots in China, fled twice to communism and twice resumed in colonial Portugal. In 1976, they landed in Macao, where Mozambique's memory had erased with the departure of the Landins, African troops that parked in the territory for decades since 1912. According to a report by Luís Andrade de Sá published in Macau magazine in 1992, and quoted by the blog "Chronicles Macanese", the Landins were in Macao "for about five decades", and "the Chinese never used to their conviviality, suspiciously who had the huge blacks who played a horrible drumsticks while returning the ostensiva. ferocity ”. The term Landim became a reference “to identify all indigenous battalions that passed by Macau”, is described in the same report. Massá Ma-chan went in 1963 to the Namphlam, northern Mozambique Conservatory to register the fifth son, but once again denied this Chinese, with roots in Guangzhou, the transmission of the nickname to descent. José Manuel was the same as his brothers: the nickname Machon, corruption of MA-chan. The identity of José Manuel Machon, embryoly marked by this bureaucratic detail imposed by the then Portuguese Mozambique, is not only a reflection of the colonial past of Portugal, but from the beginnings of Sino-Mozambican relations. “I don't have great confusion, I tried to adapt to life,” he tells Lusa in Macau, where he has lived since he was 13. The grandfather-also MA-chan-was the one who defined that this story began in Africa, leaving China looking for better life, in the starter of the twentieth century, and settling in Nampula, alongside Sharing, a Macua woman, Mozambican ethnic group. Massá, the son -and father of José Manuel -was sent to Guangzhou at 14, to receive formal education there. When he returns to Mozambique, he is a married man with a bullet mark near his left shoulder. In China, he faced the Japanese in World War II and married a Chinese, which he met on the day of marriage, until, on the threshold of the civil war, which would victory to Mao Zedong's communists, fled. He dedicated himself to Nampula to the cucumber of the cucumber-the 'Magojojo'-and the tubar bit, which he exported to Hong Kong. The Great Return However, unable to adapt, the woman returned to Macao with her four children, where she died. Massá returned to marry, this time with a Mozambican - José Manuel came first, Carla later. When the Frelimo flag raised on the mast in Mozambique on June 25, 1975, the MA-chan-headed Macao, with a brief passage in Portugal, where they inhabited a pension paid by the then IARN. “We are nothing returned, because we have not returned anywhere, we are refugees,” says Carla Machon, residing in Portugal. “When my father heard again about communism, he fled,” says his brother, José Manuel. While speaking, bowling balls pack on the floor and travel the track to a new crash. The noise in the center of Bowling Future Bright does not seem to bother this big man, 61, fluent in Cantonese and Portuguese and president of Macao Bowling Club. “This is what keeps me stable. Instead of going to the glasses, I come here,” he notes. For Joseph, independence "it was an open openness, an opening to the world." It doesn't even talk about political reasons, but how important it was to cross half a world until you arrived in Macau. A new life In this page turn, the MA-chan/maachon family came to find, in 1976, a city with little civil presence abroad. José and Carla do not remember other Mozambicans, who began to arrive after independence, many from Portugal. Mong-Há's fortress is an old witness to Mozambique's presence in Macau. Then the Landins, Mozambican soldiers at the service of the Colonial Army were quartered, recalls journalist João Guedes, a scholar in the history of Macao. It is this historical circumstance that baptized the hill of Mong-há of “Mountain of Black Ghosts”. These troops, with the “greatest warrior instinct”, in the expression of Emperor Gungunhana, remained in Macao half a century, until around the 1960s. They were responsible, for example, by the storage of the siege gates, border of the territory with China and recurring incident place. “They passed by and faded as if they had never been,” resumes Guedes, indicating that there was no material heritage attesting this military presence. Not far from Mong-Há, but at the Riquexó restaurant, troops are still there, eternalized in photos hanging on the walls. This serves African chicken, macanese dish, whose origin is still today the target of debate. Two theories: It was created by the Portuguese chief Américo Ângelo, inspired by a trip to Mozambique. Another version realizes that, seeing the African soldiers missing roasted chicken, Americo made the dish. And the memory of macau-moca-mandamous relationships is not complete without evoking the trafficking in leaf. If, on the one hand, it is known that the Portuguese took slaves from the African colonies by settling in the doors of China, in reverse, were also sent via Macao, Chinese to work in Mozambique, often in slavery conditions. The sons were part of a migratory movement from the late nineteenth century, “to develop the Mozambican colony,” explains the professor at Joaquim Chissano University in Maputo, Fatima Papelo, who investigates Sino-Mozambican cooperation. The first group, he says, was sent in 1858 and "consisted of 30 men." More than a century later, in the struggle for Mozambican independence, Beijing supported the Liberation Front of Mozambique (Frelimo) and is one of the first countries to recognize the new sovereign state. In Macao, the reinforcement of the ties was later paid, with the transition from the territory of Portugal to China in 1999. But for José Manuel, Mozambique was always present. The last time it went, tells, visited and cleaned the family campaign, "there at Machamba". "It's a Chinese custom," he explained.

item.title: DSAT | Lam hin San liability is a test to the government

item.title: Advertising | Government wants to change law and legislate “influencers”
item.description:
Macau authorities proposed for the first time regulating the activity of digital influencers, including 'live marketing', which involves real -time interaction with the public, changing a law of time from Portuguese administration
About 36 years after the entry into force of the Advertising Acting Law, the government is preparing to update the legislation, which will regulate the activities of digital influencers and live marketing, in which content creators interact or sell first-time products, with real-time interaction with the public. Plated last Friday, the 30-day public consultation, which will take place until August 2, on the amendments to the law. During this period, the government will organize five consultation sessions, where legal concepts and definitions will be discussed and clarified the terms on inspection regimes and administrative sanctions. "It is suggested to clarify that participants in online promotion activities and 'live marketing', such as advertisers, advertising agencies, platform owners and presenters, are subject to the advertising activity law and must fulfill their provisions when their acts are advertising," said the director of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT) at a press conference. The current law of advertising activity has been in force since 1989, Yau Yun Wah indicated that, considering the changes in the economic activity of the various sectors and technological evolution, "the contents, forms of dissemination and means used in current advertising are significantly different from those of the past." According to the proposal, influencers should first use the products they support, in order to ensure compliance with the “veracity” requirement of the law. They may also “have to provide proofs of their support under a 'obligation of cooperation',” said Yau Yun Wah. Own characteristics "We hope that in the future, 'advertising' [influencers] will be clearly identified in the announcements and that, in case of complaints or false allegations, legal measures may be taken," he added. The official also clarified that if companies hire influencers from outside Macao to promote products, they must obtain a work permit for them. The DSEDT director also claimed to expect the future law to allow the increase in advertising on the streets of Macau. "Through the prior authorization regime we hope that the advertising sector may have more relief and develop," said Yau Yun Wah, adding last year's advertising requests were more than 4,000. Lack of scope Deputy Ron Lam argued that changes to the advertising activity law, currently in public consultation, are not comprehensive enough, unable to cover some areas. According to the citizen newspaper, Ron Lam pointed out that despite the government's proposal to change the law to include the simplification of procedures and bring new definitions to advertising online, there are no definitions or regulations on new types of advertising, such as advertising projected by lighting or real estate. The deputy says he does not understand why the executive's proposal does not include, in real estate advertising, the advertising that is made to the vehicle parking lot. The legislator understands that there must be a transitional period and greater dissemination of information, given that the changes in the advertising regime cover several professional areas. JL /LUSA

item.title: Exports from Macao to the US sank even before the trade war
item.description: Between January and March this year, orders from the United States of America to Macao companies registered a break of 43.3 percent, compared to the same period. The order breaks came before the beginning of the trade war declared by Donald Trump against China, which entered into force on 2 April with the “Liberation Day”. Data on the breach of exports were released on Friday as part of the “conjuncture survey to the industrial sector exporting for the first quarter of 2025”. These data began to be prepared by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC), when before was in the course of the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT). This is the second consecutive break from the same period. Between the first quarter of 2023, and the first of 2024, US orders had shown a break of 16.5 percent. When the comparison is made between the last quarter of 2024 and the first quarter of this year, US orders show a 19.9 percent reduction. In homologous terms, in the first quarter of the year, interior orders grew 5.6 percent, while from other regions of Asia Pacific, excluding Hong Kong and Japan, grew 25.6 percent. However, Hong Kong orders fell 0.2 percent, while orders from Japan, the European Union did not record unchanged changes. Pessimistic expectations Regarding export prospects for the coming months, the average among exporters shows that 52.3 percent expects a decrease in trade, and among them, 27.5 percent expects a slight decrease and 24.8 percent a strong decrease. At the same time, 26.9 percent expects a “slight increase”, with no exporter that is confident in a “strong increase” in export growth. On the other hand, 20.8 percent of exporters expect stagnation. The sector in which there is greater pessimism is the export of clothing and clothing, with 99.9 percent of respondents to expect “a strong decrease” of sales abroad. At the opposite pole, the sector of pharmaceutical products is the most optimistic, with 97.2 percent of respondents to wait for a “slight increase”.

item.title: Women | Deputy wants old prison as a base of patriotism

item.title: Birth | Baby allowance requests on July 16
item.description: From July 16, it is possible to submit requests to receive the childhood assistance allowance. The information was released by the Institute of Social Action (IAS), through a statement published on Friday. This is a monthly subsidy of 1,500 patacas, created by the Executive of Sam Hou Fai, which can result in an annual support of 18 thousand patacas. The subsidy covers children who have not completed the three years of age and the request must be filed until June 30 next year. This aspect means that any child who turns three is no longer access to support, which means there may be cases where children's families are supported only for a month, as if they are 2 years and 11 months. According to the accounts presented by IAS, about 15,000 babies and children may have access to the subsidy, as it will be distributed to those born since 2022 and have not yet completed their 3 years. If the baby or child is careful of someone other than parents, it is necessary to go to the headquarters of IAS. item.title: AL | Deputies want to ban signs and implement suspensions

For the loss of the mandate, the crimes contain on or outside the MSAR, and Parliament wants to be able to make the decision based on any document that it considers relevant, even if it is not official. Controlled clothes The group of deputies also aims to prohibit at meetings the use of "clothing" or "materials with offensive content or political provocation." Deputies who proposed the amendments consider that the prohibition “in no way interferes with the rights of deputies” because “they can express any opinions”, according to the Rules. item.title: The rise of the waters
item.description: It is not only when the water retains that one realizes who was using a bath and who was not. When the level of the water rises, perhaps swimming is saved and who does not know drown. In neighboring Hong Kong, there is news of the successive closing of many insurance companies, bakeries and theaters. It is a city that claims to be an international financial center and constantly seeks ways to “break the impasse” and improve the current situation. If the method adopted is correct, it will naturally find a way out, but if an incorrect or inappropriate method is adopted, the situation will get worse. Since the beginning of the new mandate of the Government of Misrees, Macau has not faced less problems than he faced during the Covid-19 pandemic. Some difficulties have arisen due to the national and international scenario, others already have root in the past and some have recently appeared. Citibank has removed from Macau, ending its activity in the city, which, despite everything, involved a relatively small amount of assets, but the departure of an international financial institution cannot be ignored. The chief executive of Macao, as well as many government officials, will rarely have had the opportunity to use public transport. Unfortunately, I recently caught a bus on Rua do Campo and, during the short trip, a passenger sitting near the driver continually expressed his dissatisfaction with the policies of the Government of MSAR, stating that it would participate in good will in protest demonstrations if there was someone who organized them. For safety reasons, the driver did not answer him and I was standing near the door and I also chose to be silent. Given the current circumstances of Macao, it is difficult to find some group that organizes protests to demand “guarantees of employment and the quality of life of the population”. The RAE government is aware of the problems that exist. The Secretary for the Economics and Finance has just submitted in the Legislative Assembly the proposal of law entitled “Change to the Budget Law of 2025”, to recommend a budget increase of 650 million patacas to support small and medium enterprises and revitalize the landfill area (ZAPE) in response to the wave of stores and the increase in unemployment. However, there was no reference to the moment when the support and revitalization program would be started. During the mandates of the former heads of executive Hau Hau Wah and Chui Sai On, Macau exceeded significant obstacles to achieving structural economic transformation, which allowed GDP to reach new maximums in Asia and stabilize the political and social scenario. The impact of Covid-19 pandemic in Macao represented an unforeseen disaster, but man's losses are preventable. Confronted with the wave of closing business, unemployment and uncertainties caused by international commercial conflicts, then waves of shocks will appear behind each other. When it is mentioned that Macau is “a center” refers that it is the world center of tourism and leisure, and not just the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay Tourism and Leisure Center. Attract more international tourists to Macao and encouraging them to consume while in the city is absolutely crucial. Turning the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao into Hengqin into a commercial service platform between China and Portuguese -language countries can be more practical and beneficial for Macau than actively promoting the proper diversification strategy of the “1 + 4” economy. Chinese culture emphasizes harmony and inclusion, and only adopting this guiding principle becomes possible coexistence and diversity, thus shaping a healthy society through the exchange between Chinese culture and western culture. Can Macau reach true harmony and inclusion? If we row toward the ends of the world, instead of being stopped on the beach, it doesn't matter if the water level rises or not.

item.title: Climate change and contradictions of Lula da Silva
item.description: The fact that Brazil is the fifth largest country of the globe and the seventh in terms of the number of inhabitants justifies that its president, Lula da Silva, is a politician who arouses curiosity globally. It was partly thanks to its governments that Brazil's Human Development Index (HHP3) has significantly progressed, having reached a list of 193 countries, 89th in 2024, according to the Human Development Report 2023/2024, prepared by the United Nations Development Program (UNDP). Elected three times, Lula da Silva held the presidency from 2003 to 2011 and 2023 until today. From its policy stand out the programs “Bolsa Familia” and “Hunger Zero”, recognized by the United Nations as having contributed to considerably alleviating hunger in Brazil. In addition to the fight against hunger, they are also areas where there was greater development, health and longevity, due to investment in the Unified Health System and increased vaccination programs. In the field of education there were significant progress thanks to incentives for more children and adolescents to attend primary and high school. Initiatives such as the “University for All Program” (ProUni) and the “Student Financing Fund” (FIES) contributed to a larger number of college students from low -income population layers. It is due to this large country that the Portuguese language is one of the most spoken in the world and the most used in the southern hemisphere. On the internet it occupies fifth place 4, far above the eighth place on the list, according to the translation company “Gama!”. Brazil is also a cause for attention mainly because it has much of the Amazon, the largest rainforest in the globe5. This forest, which extends to 9 countries, has about 60% of its extension in Brazil, hence the great responsibility of the governments of this country to preserve it, not only in its own benefit, but also from the whole planet. In the time of the government of Jair Bolsonaro (2019 - 2022), steps have taken back regarding the protection of the Amazon, namely the increase in clandestine mining exploitation and agribusiness, resulting in increased deforestation, pollution of numerous water courses with strong health repercussions of indigenous populations and biodiversity. It was the time when the “land grabbers” 6 again had more freedom in their activity of falsifying documents that were intended to be proof of land ownership that were actually occupied illegally. After these four years of a far-right government, the country has been directed again by rulers who care about the primary role that Amazon has in the regulation of climate on the global scale and the well-being of indigenous populations. The biosphere is one of the components of the climate system that the most influence has the regulation of climate on the global scale. Much of this component consists of the Amazon, given the most extensive tropical rainforest, with almost seven million square kilometers. item.title: We are! | Portuguese theater from Lisbon to Macau with “Júlio César”
item.description:
“Júlio César” is the play of the Chapitô Company, based in Lisbon, chosen to come to Macau in September. Also noteworthy is for the holding of physical and visual theater workshops in connection with the community, in a Somos initiative! - Portuguese Language Communication Association
September marks the arrival of an important Portuguese group linked to the circus arts and has been developing community connection projects in Lisbon for many years, receiving students and all people interested in their cultural offer. This group is the Chapitô Company, which thanks to Somos's initiative! - ACLP (Portuguese Language Communication Association), brings Macau, between September 20 and 23, the play “Júlio César” and the holding of physical and visual theater workshops, open to participants with or without experience in theater. The play “Júlio César” takes the stage of the Black Box I of the Cultural Center of Macau, on September 20, at 20h. This is the 39th collective creation of the company, and Chapitô was inspired, according to a note from Somos! - ACLP, "in life and historical events around Julius Caesar, exploring comedy as a language to reinvent history." Julius Caesar was a Roman general and a state man. Member of the first triumvirate, led the Roman armies in conquering Gaul before defeating his political rival Pompey in the context of civil war. Self-proceedings later, he is a perpetual dictator of Rome, a position he did not occupy for a long time, murdered by a group of senators who considered him a threat to the Republic. “Inspired by the popular imagination of the representations of Rome and the remarkable figure that it was Julius Caesar, exploring historical inconsistencies and taking freedoms in the treatment of documented facts - with the disregard that already characterizes the company of Chapitô - this is the deconsion of another historical monster, Julius Caesar,” says Somos! - ACLP on the show. “If he was a tyrant who deserved to die or a hero brutally murdered by conspirators, come the devil and choose. Here there are no heroes or villains, there are circumstances and cunning people who do for life. There are also less cunning people who do what they send them. And virtuous people who do what has to be done. Physical theater In Chapitô, a project led by Maria Teresa Ricou, they are “faithful to the physical theater style”, where “actors use the body, movement and gesture to create characters and transmit emotions universally, allowing an accessible experience to different audiences”. In Macao, and at the end of “Júlio César”, Chapitô Company will provide conversation and debate sessions, “promoting direct cultural exchange between artists and the audience thus leading to an exchange of ideas and reflections on the present theatrical experience”. The piece will be presented in Portuguese and subtitled in Chinese with approximately 90 minutes without break. Tickets have a value of 200 MOP and can already be purchased through Macauticket. To learn On September 21, 22 and 23, the Chapitô team presents, at Casa Garden, the physical and visual theater workshops, which aim to “explore improvisation techniques, character creation and nonverbal communication, using the body as a central tool for artistic and narrative expression”. There are in these sessions a division into three themes - body, space and improvisation; Gestural characters and archetypes; and dramatic game and creative improvisation, being the sessions led by trainers Jorge Cruz, Pedro Diogo and Susana Nunes. The workshops are taught in English with translation to Chinese and with a maximum capacity of 20 participants. Founded in 1996, the Chapitô Company is recognized for its multidisciplinary work, based on physical theater and communication through gesture and image. Still according to Somos! -ACLP, the performance of the show “Júlio César” and the physical and visual theater workshops, in Macao, “participants have the opportunity to explore the possibilities of interaction and fusion between different forms of artistic expression”, revealing to the public of Macao “the methodologies and the artistic vision of the Chapitô Company”. Thus, the association understands, “this experience can inspire new approaches and ideas of cultural exchange”.

Topics such as the “History and Legacy of Spices: Review of the Origins of Fusion Cuisine”, “Flavors Symphony: Fusion Culinary in Modern Macao and the World” and “Spices as a Bridge: Celebration of Cultural Fusion and Communities”. According to a STD note, it is intended in these conversations to “explore [the history] of the commercial routes of spices and links to gastronomic cultures from various regions of the world”, as well as “innovations in the use of spices in traditional culinaries, cultural lineage and Asian fusion kitchens facing innovation”. item.title: City of Dreams | The magic of the fashion world in the Horst P. Horst lens
item.description:
Lovers of fashion and beauty can visit, by September, an exhibition dedicated to the work of fashion photographer Horst P. Horst patent at City of Dreams. “Horst: Style Photographer” is an “iconic fashion photography” exhibition held in conjunction with the prestigious Albert Museum London
It was born at the time when fashion was almost an art form, taking a long time to democratize and reach stores and people. This more classic side of fabrics and seams was certainly eternalized in the photograph by Horst P. Horst, which became one of the great fashion photographers and was born in 1906, named Horst Paul Albert Bohrmann. Horst, who died in 1999, left many full career images of a full career to photograph models, clothing and actresses, creating beauty imaginary that can now be seen closely in a display in the City of Dreams (COD), organized in conjunction with Albert Museum London. The show is called “Horst: Style Photographer” [Horst: Photograph of Style] and was inaugurated this Wednesday, revealing the work of this photographer over 60 years. Quoted by a COD statement, Duncan Forbes, director of photography of the London V&A Museum, another of the partners in the organization of this exhibition, spoke on the eclectic side of the work of Horst P. Horst, and can be seen in this show. “From the iconic covers of [magazine] Vogue to the impressive color impressions, Horst's work personifies timeless elegance - a celebration of beauty, posture and artistic accuracy. City of Dreams, with its rich fusion of fashion, design and contemporary art, perfectly reflects the spirit of Horst's work. Horst legacy with a new and demanding audience, ”he said. The exhibition presents a selection of the most representative works of Horst's work, divided into five central themes: “High Couture”, “Surrealism”, “Color Fashion”, “Living with Style” and “Stage and Scree”. According to the same statement, it reveals the “serene elegance of the Parisian couture” and the “bold surrealist explorations”, not forgetting “the pioneering color photography to the vivid portraits of cinema icons”. All of this is up to an “exhibition that offers a rich and multidimensional view of the Horst artistic universe”. Chinese photography In addition, the public will be able to see a special section entitled “Tribute to Horst”, which features works by five influential Chinese photographers, namely Hai Feng, Nick Yang, Trunk Xu, Wu Zeng and Yuangui Mei. This part offers “a glimpse of Chinese fashion photography of the last thirty years, showing its rich cultural dialogues and artistic advances”, which “captures the fascinating interaction between tradition and modernity, oriental and western aesthetics, as well as timeless elegance and contemporary innovation”, highlights Cod. According to the same note, Horst P. Horst is widely considered one of the most influential fashion photographers of the twentieth century, famous for its masterful use of light and meticulous composition. His creative career lasted more than six decades, shaped by artistic movements such as surrealism and the rise of color photography. Its work is known for dramatic tension and artistic depth, providing incomparable aesthetics that remain unparalleled. Horst has also captured some of the most legendary figures in art, literature and fashion - including Coco Chanel, Salvador Dalí, Marlene Dietrich and Andy Warhol - leaving behind an unforgettable legacy. Tim Kelly, president of COD, said, about this exhibition, that "it is a fundamental step in our view of integrating art into everyday life." "The lasting elegance and the innovative creativity of Horst photography are perfectly aligned with the philosophy of our brand. We hope this exhibition will become a platform for creative exchange, where art arouses new ideas and inaugurates a new paradigm where tradition and innovation meet," he said. "Horst: Photography of Style" can be seen on the first floor of Cod until September 12 this year, inviting residents and tourists to "explore a world of timeless fashion, art and light and celebrate the legacy of one of the greatest masters of photography."

item.title: Cape Verde | Macau Legend says he has alternative to Hotel-Casino
item.description:
While the reversal process of the company linked to David Chow, Macau Legend will have a “last opportunity” to find a solution for the Praia's unfinished casino hotel
The Cape Verde Internal Affairs Minister told Lusa that the government will give Macau Legend a "last opportunity", which promised "an alternative" for the beach-casino hotel on the beach. "The entrepreneur has had several opportunities and has this last opportunity. He says he will have an alternative and the government is awaiting the presentation of this alternative, while the reversal process takes place" of the project, said Paulo Rocha in an interview with Lusa. In November, the Cape Verde authorities began a reversal process of the Hotel Casino and other unfinished works of Macau Legend, at Santa Maria Island and Gamboa Sea Marítimo, in Praia City. Paulo Rocha said that the Cape Verdean executive gave the company founded by David Chow Kam Fai 60 days to present a new proposal to conclude the project, but admitted not to know when this period "started to count". "If it does not present, within the period that was given, the reversal process will be concluded and then the government will look for others, likely, any investors," said the minister, during a visit to Macao. Stop everything Currently, there are only guards at the venue, an area of ​​about 160,000 square meters, which includes the partially sparkled Santa Maria islet and, a paved bridge of a few meters that connects it to a building of about eight floors, empty and sealed with tails. "The works have been stopped for a long time, have been halfway through there is no movement in that construction shipyard and the government intends to see it resolved. In one way or another," said Rocha. The executive said in November that he gave Macao Legend "all opportunities to resume works or to negotiate the sale of actions or the assignment of his contractual position to a potential interested in continuing the project" but no alternatives were presented. "The project remains important, remains strategic for the city of Praia, for Cape Verde, and the government is interested in finding a solution," said the minister. In 2015, David Chow signed an agreement for an investment of 250 million euros. After revisions, about six years ago, the conclusion of the first phase was scheduled for 2021. At the end of 2023, Macau Legend President Li Chu Kwan said the group intended to close the projects in Cape Verde and Cambodia by 2025. The operator reiterated that she was “taking the necessary measures to safeguard the group's interests (…), including exploring all available options to contest the decision” regarding the reversal process of the Cape Verdean Hotel Casino. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. item.title: Dalai-Lama | India remains on the sidelines of succession
item.description: The Indian government assured Friday that it will remain on the sidelines of the choice of Dalai-Lama successor, contrasting with China who rejects the process and considers the Tibetan spiritual leader a separatist of the annexed region. In a statement about Dalai-Lama's succession plan, the Narendra Moder's Foreign Ministry of Government states that he will not take “any position” on issues of faith. "The government of India does not take any position or pronouncement on issues related to beliefs and practices of faith and religion," said Ministry spokesman Randhir Jaiswal, in response to media questions about the recent announcement of the Tibetan spiritual leader. The country "has always defended religious freedom to everyone in India and will continue to do so," he said. On Thursday, the Indian minister of minority affairs, Kiren Rijiju, told local media that the decision would be exclusively to the Buddhist leader. "All those who follow Dalai-Lama believe that reincarnation must be decided according to the established conventions and Dalai-Lama's own wishes. No one else has the right to decide, except for him and the current conventions," said Rijiju. China reiterated on Wednesday that Dalai-Lama's successor should be "approved by the central government." "The reincarnation of great Buddhists, such as Dalai-Lama and Panchen Lama, should be determined by draw through the golden ballot box and later approved by the central government," said China's Ministry of Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning.

item.title: Japan ready for all scenarios on tariffs
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigero Ishiba said on Sunday that the country is ready to “stay firm” and is prepared for all possible tariff scenarios that may result from commercial negotiations with the United States. Speaking on the "Sunday News, The Prime" program of the Japanese television channel Fuji TV, the ruler stressed the determination of Tokyo in negotiating the application of null customs rights - Zero tariff - in the automotive industry sector. Shigeru Ishiba also recalled that Japan is the largest foreign direct investor in the United States and the largest job creator in the world's largest economy. Japan's main commercial negotiator, Ryosi Akazawa, announced this Saturday that he maintained two telephone meetings with United States Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, to discuss customs rights, at a time of July 9 to impose the increase in rates by Washington. Akazawa and Lutnick spoke for 45 minutes on Thursday and for about an hour on Saturday, reaffirmed their positions on United States customs rights and “proceeded to exchange in-depth points,” according to a statement from the Japanese government secretariat. The parties will continue to coordinate, it adds in the statement. Written letters The phone calls took place at a time when a 10 percent rate of Japan sales to the United States is expected to return to 24 percent on July 9, if the tariff agreement is not closed. US President Donald Trump announced on Friday that he signed 12 letters, which will be sent this Monday to inform the commercial partners of the new customs of the United States about their exports to the US, which will begin to be applied next August 1st. Trump did not specify which countries will receive the letters. In addition to the broader tariffs, as with other countries, Japan is also subject to a 25 percent rate on the importation of automobiles and automotive components by the US and a 50 percent rate on steel and aluminum.

item.title: Brazil | Petrobras seeks Chinese investment
item.description: Petrobras' board of directors Magda Chambriard announced that Brazilian oil company is looking for Chinese investment to help improve her maritime transport and infrastructure. A memorandum of understanding signed this Saturday together together the Chinese companies Cosco, Offshore Oil Engineering Co, China State Shipbuilding Co and China International Marine Containers Ltd., as well as Brazilian companies EBR, Rio Grande, Mauá, Enseada and Atlantic South. The state -owned company Brazilian and its subsidiary of transpetro logistics will serve as anchors for potential technological and commercial partnerships. "We would like the Chinese to be partners in shipyards here," Chambriard said at an event with Brazilian and Chinese executives held in Rio de Janeiro. "We expect the injection of Chinese capital." In addition to the construction of five floating platforms of production, storage and discharge, which will be hired by 2030, Petrobras and Transpetro intend to order 52 new vessels by 2026. The Brazilian Federal Government wants part of the fleet renewal program, worth 29 billion reais (4.54 billion euros), be invested in local shipyards, meeting the plans of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to boost the transforming industry. Brazil's naval construction industry has faced difficulties since the outbreak in 2014 of the corruption scandal known as Lava-Jato, which involved Petrobras. Last year, the oil company resumed orders to Brazilian naval shipyards, interrupted since 2016.

item.title: Cooperation | Cape Verde wants “more and better” Chinese investment
item.description:
Cape Verdean Minister Paulo Rocha stated that the country wants to follow up on the good relations between the two countries that are already feeling mainly at the level of SMEs and grow the level of partnerships

item.title: Tariffs | Beijing evaluates the USA-VIETNAME Pact and promises to protect your interests
item.description: The China Ministry of Commerce yesterday expressed “firm opposition to any trade agreement achieved at the expense of China's interests,” reacting to the announced pact between the United States and Vietnam, and admitted to adopting contracted. "What Washington designates as 'reciprocal tariffs' about its trading partners is a unilateral intimidation practice, to which China has always opposed," Tutelae spokesman He Yongqian said at a press conference. According to the official, Beijing "has taken a note of the situation and is evaluating it", stressing that China encourages the parties to solve economic and commercial differences "based on equality and through dialogue", but firmly rejects agreements that harm their interests. "If such a situation is confirmed, China will be resolutely adopted and will protect its legitimate rights and interests," he said. On Wednesday, US President Donald Trump announced on social networks a tariff agreement with Vietname that reduces to 20 percent customs imposed in April to imports from that Southeast Asian country, but raises to 40 percent on Hanoi and originating from third countries. Washington accuses Vietnam of functioning as a transhipment platform for Chinese exports after the transfer of several factories from China to the neighboring country following Trump's tariffs during his first term (2017-2021).

item.title: Wang Yi exhorts European Union to avoid confrontation
item.description: Chinese diplomacy chief Wang Yi yesterday warned his European homologous against the risks of confrontation, at a time when Beijing seeks to affirm himself as a reliable partner, compared to US volatility. During a meeting held on Wednesday in Brussels, with the head of European Union diplomacy, Kaja Kallas, Wang Yi argued that China and the EU “should not be seen as opponents for their differences, nor seek confrontation due to their disagreements,” according to a statement released yesterday by his ministry. The day before, Kallas argued that Beijing should no longer threaten European security, pointing out alleged cybers, interference in democratic processes and unfair business practices. "Europe faces several challenges," said Wang Yi, adding that none of them, "in the past, present or future," was caused by China. Alternative via Chinese diplomacy head sought to introduce his country as a counterweight to Donald Trump's administration, which threatened to impose widespread tariffs on European imports. “The path followed by the United States should not be used as a mirror of China,” said Wang. "China is not the United States," he said. According to the statement of the Chinese Foreign Ministry, both sides also addressed international issues such as the War in Ukraine, the Israelo-Palestinian conflict and the Iran's nuclear program. Beijing and Brussels should act based on “mutual respect,” defended Wang Yi, appealing to a more “active and pragmatic” European policy in relation to China. Wang also met on Wednesday with the President of the European Commission, Ursula Von Der Leyen, and Belgian Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot. Wang told both parts that China and EU should “defend multilateralism and free trade” and cooperate over global challenges such as climate change. The Chinese diplomat now goes to Germany and then to France, where he will meet with French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot, who visited China in March. These visits precede the China - EU Cimeira, which will bring together in Beijing Chinese President Xi Jinping and several senior European responsible.

item.title: USA / China | Closed agreement that provides for rare land and chip design software
item.description:
The two nations resumed the path of understanding last month in Geneva
United States and China formalized a commercial understanding reached last month in Geneva, which includes Beijing's commitment to resume rare land exports, US Secretary of Trade, Howard Lutnick said. According to Lutnick, the agreement was signed two days ago and consecrates the terms negotiated between Washington and Beijing throughout this year after successive mutual accusations of violation of previous agreements. "They will give us rare lands and, when they do, we will raise our contracted," he said in an interview with Bloomberg. Siemens AG, one of the world's leading semiconductor design software suppliers, has been released by the United States Department of Commerce from the need to request licenses to operate in the Chinese market, according to the German company in a statement. Export restrictions had been imposed in May, as part of a package of measures adopted by the United States in response to Chinese limitations on rare land exports. Siemens has confirmed that it has restored full access to its software and technology for Chinese customers. The other two main world companies in the Electronic Design Automation Software sector (EDA) - Cadence Design Systems Inc. and Synopsys Inc. - They have not yet responded to commenting on whether they received similar communications, according to Bloomberg news agency. The United States Department of Trade has not commented either, the agency added. The rare lands are crucial materials used in the production of wind turbines, aircraft, semiconductors and advanced technology. Under the commercial agreement last week, Washington has committed to authorizing the shipping to China's chip software, ethane and jet engines, as long as Beijing meets the promise of accelerating the approval of critical mineral exports. An White House official confirmed that the two countries agreed with the terms necessary to apply the Geneva Agreement. The China Embassy in Washington refused to comment, while the Chinese Foreign Ministry did not respond immediately. Markets applaud The signing of the agreement generated optimism in the markets: Asian shareholders and future Europeans have advanced, and a global stock index has reached a new historical maximum. Lutnick indicated that US President Donald Trump intends to conclude, until July 9, a series of ten commercial agreements with the main US partners. "We will close the ten main agreements, organize them by categories, and the other countries will align after that," he explained. Although he did not specify which countries involved, Trump suggested yesterday that the US is close to an understanding with India. The main Japanese negotiator, Ryosi Akazawa, also has scheduled meetings in the US capital, and reiterated that Japan "cannot accept" 25 percent tariffs on cars. Trump has already stated that, in the absence of agreements until July 9, he will send "letters" to each country with the proposed terms, applying unilateral tariffs - the so -called "reciprocal tariffs", which may reach up to 50 percent. Most of these measures were announced on April 2, but suspended for 90 days to allow negotiations. The actual scope of the agreements remains uncertain, as commercial pacts usually require years of negotiations. item.title: Timor-Leste | IMF foresees economic growth of 3.9% in 2025
item.description:

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.
